response:

However, I need to consider the inflation factor. If I reject this offer and we go to the next round, any amount I receive will be worth 20% less to me. That means if I were to counter-offer and somehow get the full $10,000 in the next round, it would only be worth $8,000 to me due to inflation.

Since $5,000 now is worth more to me than potentially getting a larger nominal amount in future rounds (when accounting for inflation), and the offer is fair on its face, I should accept.
